issues.title: Amplification
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
"In addition to any amplification, the opportunity for the rate and opportunity of unauthenticated reflection seems problematic.  One possible thing to consider would be to stipulate that debugging should only be returned for an already existing connection by default, as opposed to sending it to any more easily-spoofed packet (e.g., initial SYN).  This would at least minimize the risk by forcing an attacker to be able to spoof the connection details.  I think this is what the document implies, but I'm not sure it is clear.

Another thing that might reduce the risk is to stipulate rate limits like routers do for ICMP messages. See 4.3.2.8 Rate Limiting in IETF RFC 1812 for example.
"

issues.title: CBOR  or not CBOR
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
> - Let's not make TCP have a normative dependency on CBOR. The payload 
> structure is simple enough that it can be defined in this doc.
> 

[Med] The use of cbor is for convenience (compact encoding, ease of validation, avoid issues with random strings, etc.), but we are open to what the WG would decide. 

There are other encoding formats as in the various variants out there: such as https://my.f5.com/manage/s/article/K89012646, https://support.citrix.com/s/article/CTX200852-citrix-adc-netscaler-reset-codes-reference?language=en_US, https://isc.sans.edu/diary/The+special+case+of+TCP+RST/26824, etc.

issues.title: Reason description
issues.author: tireddy2
issues.body:
reason-description: : Includes a brief description of the reset reason encoded as UTF-8 {{!RFC3629}}. This parameter SHOULD NOT be included if a reason code is supplied. This parameter is useful only for reset reasons that are not yet registered or for application- specific reset reasons.

Comment> I suggest to replace "SHOULD NOT" with "MUST NOT".
Comment> In the Security consideration section, modify the text as follows:

The reason description, when present, MUST NOT be displayed to end users but is intended to be consumed by applications.
